introduction.p: Shown below are two graphs depicting the velocity of falling objects. On the left is the velocity of a skydiver, while on the right is the velocity of a meteorite entering the Earth's atmosphere.

statement.p: Begin with the skydiver's velocity and use the given graph to measure the rate of change dv/dt when the velocity is v=0.5, 1.0, 1.5, 2.0, and 2.5. Plot your values on the graph below. statement.p: You should find that all your points lie on a line. Write the equation of this line being careful to use proper notation for the quantities on the horizontal and vertical axes.

solution.p: Using the values in parts (a) and (b), we obtain \frac{dv}{dt} = -0.6v + 1.8.

statement.p: The relationship you just found is a differential equation. Write a complete sentence that explains its meaning.

answer.p: The rate of change of velocity with respect to time is a linear function of velocity.

solution.p: This differential equation means that the rate of change of velocity with respect to time is a linear function of velocity.

statement.p: By looking at the differential equation, determine the values of the velocity for which the velocity increases.

solution.p: The velocity increases when \frac{dv}{dt} \gt 0. So the velocity increases when 0 \lt v \lt 3.

statement.p: By looking at the differential equation, determine the values of the velocity for which the velocity decreases.

solution.p: The velocity decreases when \frac{dv}{dt} \lt 0. So the velocity decreases when 3 \lt v \lt 5.

statement.p: By looking at the differential equation, determine the values of the velocity for which the velocity remains constant.

solution.p: The velocity will remain constant when \frac{dv}{dt} = 0, which is when v = 3.
